ground_truth: Leslie is telling the story of the traumatic audition which may have turned her life. As they pass Melvin, she does not break stride nor give him notice, though she is aware of him -- resentfully so -- hard not to be since he is giving a moment-to-moment commentary on her every action. Melvin stops, and she passes behind him to deliver an uncharacteristic rabbit punch. Melvin just looks at her. She exits. The greenhouse studio is a busy sanctuary as Simon puts the finishing touches on his painting of Vincent. Vincent quickly and expertly picks a CD to meet his immediate needs and puts it on, dying a little at every second of silence during the transition; he gestures Vincent to take it down. A beat and then a strange figure crosses between the CAMERA and the scene, gone before we can examine him further, where it is not clear that a robbery is in progress—Vincent's two friends from the street sweep all objects into large sacks—one of them, Doug, pauses to look past the terrace to the studio. And he uses the hat rack first as a spear, then as a club, as the brief savage attack begins. The three attackers leave, and Vincent starts to go toward Simon and then scurries back in fear. A single BARK from VERDELL. A mass of OFFICIAL PEOPLE clutter the hall as a gurney is whisked down to the elevator. Melvin is standing against the wall near his door, and a cop, RAY, is interviewing him. Frank stands upset, anxious, holding a dog bowl, a leash, and VERDELL, who is more upset, making pathetic little CRYING. As we FOCUS BRIEFLY ON Verdell, Frank is talking to the Sweet-Faced Woman. A short laugh makes us realize that Melvin has witnessed and enjoyed Frank's hostile mutterings. VERDELL starts WHIMPERING as a pissed Frank approaches his mugger. Frank pushes open the door to Melvin's apartment and places Verdell inside. We STAY with the dog during the O.S. VERDELL STOPS—gives Melvin wide berth—slinking along the far wall. Melvin finds Verdell's fear of him a bit calming. Melvin breaks two eggs over a large pile of prime chopped meat, sticks raw pieces of bacon into it, and exits the room. Ignoring Verdell, he sits at the piano and hits one key repeatedly, his recent past making him suspect this feast is a trick. Verdell looks over with surprise and pleasure. Verdell shifts his body so he is eating from the bowl with his tail to Melvin. Frank is on the phone. As Jackie enters, he turns toward her. Simon's face is something of a horror, and the sight is a jolt.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Leslie is narrating the tale of the harrowing tryout which might have altered her existence. As they pass Melvin, she does not break pace nor give him attention, though she is conscious of him -- bitterly so -- difficult not to be since he is giving a moment-to-moment narration on her every gesture. Melvin halts, and she moves behind him to deliver an uncharacteristic rabbit blow. Melvin just glances at her. She departs. The greenhouse studio is a bustling refuge as Simon applies the final touches on his depiction of Vincent. Vincent swiftly and adeptly selects a CD to meet his immediate desires and plays it, perishing a bit at every instant of quiet during the transition; he signals Vincent to lower it. A beat and then an unfamiliar figure passes between the CAMERA and the scene, vanished before we can scrutinize him further, where it is not evident that a theft is underway—Vincent's two companions from the avenue gather all items into large bags—one of them, Doug, hesitates to gaze past the terrace to the studio. And he utilizes the hat stand first as a lance, then as a cudgel, as the brief ferocious assault commences. The three assailants depart, and Vincent begins to move toward Simon and then dashes back in terror. A solitary BARK from VERDELL. A multitude of OFFICIAL PEOPLE congest the corridor as a stretcher is whisked down to the elevator. Melvin is standing against the wall near his entrance, and a cop, RAY, is questioning him. Frank stands distressed, nervous, holding a dog dish, a tether, and VERDELL, who is more distressed, making pathetic little SOBBING. As we FOCUS BRIEFLY ON Verdell, Frank is speaking to the Sweet-Faced Woman. A brief chuckle makes us realize that Melvin has observed and relished Frank's hostile murmurs. VERDELL begins WHIMPERING as an annoyed Frank approaches his aggressor. Frank pushes open the door to Melvin's apartment and places Verdell inside. We STAY with the canine during the O.S. VERDELL PAUSES—gives Melvin wide berth—slipping along the far wall. Melvin finds Verdell's dread of him somewhat soothing. Melvin cracks two eggs over a large mound of prime minced meat, sticks uncooked strips of bacon into it, and departs the room. Disregarding Verdell, he sits at the piano and presses one key repeatedly, his recent past making him suspect this banquet is a ruse. Verdell looks over with astonishment and delight. Verdell shifts his form so he is eating from the dish with his tail to Melvin. Frank is on the phone. As Jackie enters, he turns toward her. Simon's visage is something of a nightmare, and the sight is a shock.

A beat and then a strange figure crosses between the CAMERA and the scene, gone before we can examine him further, where he does not make it clear that a robbery is in progress—Vincent's two friends from the street sweep all objects into large sacks—one of them, Doug, pauses to look past the terrace to the studio. And the hat rack is used by him first as a spear, then as a club, as the brief savage attack begins. Simon's face is something of a horror, and a jolt is given by the sight.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Leslie recounts a traumatic audition that may have changed her life. Passing Melvin without breaking stride, she resents his constant commentary. She unexpectedly hits him, and he just looks at her as she leaves. In the busy greenhouse studio, Simon finishes painting Vincent, who expertly picks a CD to ease the silence, gesturing Vincent to lower the volume. A mysterious figure briefly interrupts, hinting at an ongoing robbery as Vincent's street friends sweep items into sacks. Doug, one of the thieves, uses a hat rack aggressively. The attackers flee, causing Vincent to retreat in fear. Verdell barks as officials fill the hall, whisking away a gurney. Melvin stands by his door during Ray's interview. Frank, anxious with Verdell, witnesses Melvin amused by Frank's mutterings. Verdell whimpers when Frank confronts his mugger. Frank places Verdell in Melvin's apartment. Verdell, fearful of Melvin, finds his calm, watching Melvin prepare a meal, suspicious of a trick. Verdell, surprised and pleased, eats with his tail facing Melvin. Frank talks on the phone as Jackie enters, witnessing Simon's horrifying appearance.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Leslie recounts a traumatic audition that may have changed her life. She passes Melvin, aware of his annoying commentary but ignores him. Melvin stops, and she punches him, but he just looks at her. She leaves. In the greenhouse studio, Simon finishes a painting of Vincent, who selects a CD, anxious during its silent transition. A strange figure briefly appears, revealing a robbery. Vincent's friends Doug and another thief sweep items into sacks. Doug uses a hat rack as a weapon during the attack. The attackers leave, and frightened Vincent retreats. A single bark from Verdell breaks the tension. Official personnel crowd the hall as a gurney is moved. Melvin stands near his door, being interviewed by cop Ray. Frank is upset, holding Verdell, who whines. Frank talks to a Sweet-Faced Woman, while Melvin enjoys Frank's anger. Verdell whimpers as Frank approaches Melvin's apartment and leaves Verdell inside. Verdell avoids Melvin, who finds the dog's fear calming. Melvin prepares a meal, leaves the room, and plays the piano, suspicious of Verdell's delight. Verdell eats with his tail toward Melvin. Frank is on the phone as Jackie enters. Simon's appearance is shocking.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Leslie is recounting the story of a particularly traumatic audition, one that may have significantly altered the course of her life. As they make their way past Melvin, she maintains her stride without any interruption and refrains from acknowledging his presence, even though she is acutely aware of him — and resentfully so — as it is nearly impossible not to notice him since he is persistently providing a moment-by-moment commentary on her each and every action. Melvin eventually comes to a stop, and Leslie, seizing the opportunity, moves behind him to deliver an unexpectedly uncharacteristic rabbit punch. Melvin merely looks at her in response. She makes her exit. Meanwhile, the greenhouse studio serves as a buzzing sanctuary where Simon is meticulously putting the final touches on his painting of Vincent. Vincent, with swift and expert precision, selects a CD to fulfill his immediate needs and plays it, feeling a twinge of anguish at each passing second of silence during the transition; he gestures for Vincent to take it down. There is a brief pause, and then an unusual figure quickly crosses between the CAMERA and the ongoing scene, vanishing before any detailed examination can be made, leaving it unclear that a robbery is underway—Vincent's two companions from the street proceed to sweep all items into large sacks—one of them, Doug, briefly pauses to gaze beyond the terrace toward the studio. He then uses the hat rack initially as a spear and subsequently as a club, initiating a brief yet savage attack. As the three assailants make their departure, Vincent begins to move toward Simon but quickly scurries back, overcome by fear. A solitary BARK comes from VERDELL. The hallway is crowded with a mass of OFFICIAL PEOPLE as a gurney is swiftly wheeled down toward the elevator. Melvin is standing against the wall, not far from his door, while a cop named RAY is conducting an interview with him. Frank stands there, visibly upset and anxious, holding onto a dog bowl, a leash, and VERDELL, who appears even more distressed, emitting pathetic little CRYING sounds. As we briefly FOCUS ON Verdell, Frank is in conversation with the Sweet-Faced Woman. A short burst of laughter reveals that Melvin has observed and found amusement in Frank's hostile mutterings. VERDELL begins WHIMPERING as an irritated Frank approaches his mugger. Frank pushes open the door to Melvin's apartment and places Verdell inside. We remain focused on the dog during the ensuing OFF-SCREEN activity. VERDELL STOPS—gives Melvin a wide berth—cautiously slinking along the far wall. Melvin finds some solace in Verdell’s evident fear of him. Melvin breaks two eggs over a substantial pile of prime chopped meat, inserting raw pieces of bacon into it, and then exits the room. Paying no attention to Verdell, he seats himself at the piano and repeatedly hits one key, his recent past leading him to suspect that this feast is merely some kind of trick. Verdell glances over with a mix of surprise and pleasure. Verdell shifts his position so that he is eating from the bowl with his tail facing Melvin. Frank is busy on the phone. As Jackie makes her entrance, he turns his attention toward her. The sight of Simon's face is quite horrifying, and the shock of it is jarring.

He then utilizes the hat rack, initially as a spear and subsequently as a club, to initiate a brief yet savage attack. As the three assailants make their hasty departure, Vincent begins to move toward Simon but quickly scurries back, overcome with fear. A solitary BARK comes from VERDELL. The hallway is crowded with a mass of OFFICIAL PEOPLE, and a gurney is swiftly wheeled down toward the elevator. Melvin stands against the wall, not far from his door, while a police officer named RAY conducts an interview with him. Frank stands there, visibly upset and anxious, clutching a dog bowl, a leash, and VERDELL, who appears even more distressed, emitting pathetic little CRYING sounds. As we momentarily FOCUS ON Verdell, Frank is engaged in conversation with the Sweet-Faced Woman. A short burst of laughter reveals that Melvin has noticed and derived amusement from Frank's hostile mutterings. VERDELL begins WHIMPERING as an irritated Frank moves toward his mugger. Frank swings open the door to Melvin's apartment and places Verdell inside. We remain intently focused on the dog during the ensuing OFF-SCREEN activity. VERDELL STOPS—gives Melvin a wide berth—cautiously slinking along the far wall. Melvin derives some solace from Verdell’s evident fear of him. Melvin breaks two eggs over a substantial pile of prime chopped meat, inserting raw pieces of bacon into it, and then exits the room. Paying no heed to Verdell, he seats himself at the piano and repeatedly strikes one key, his recent past experiences leading him to suspect that this feast is merely some kind of trick. Verdell glances over with a mix of surprise and pleasure. Verdell shifts his position so that he is eating from the bowl with his tail facing Melvin. Frank is occupied on the phone. As Jackie makes her entrance, he turns his attention toward her. The sight of Simon's face is quite horrifying, and the shock of it is truly jarring.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Leslie, with every detail of the traumatic audition weighing on her, recounts the events that may have changed her life, her voice steady despite the emotional undertone. As she and her companion pass by Melvin, she maintains her pace and deliberately avoids acknowledging him, though she is acutely aware of his presence. Her resentment simmers beneath the surface, unavoidable as Melvin continues to provide a running commentary on her every move. Without pausing, Melvin halts his own steps, and Leslie, seizing the moment, veers subtly to pass behind him, delivering an unexpected and uncharacteristic rabbit punch, momentarily connecting with him. Melvin merely looks at her, his expression unreadable as Leslie exits the scene. Meanwhile, within the bustling greenhouse studio, a space that serves as a busy sanctuary, Simon concentrates intently as he meticulously applies the finishing touches to his painting of Vincent. Vincent, moving with a sense of urgency and expertise, swiftly selects a CD that aligns with his current emotional requirements and places it into the player, acutely feeling each passing moment of silence as the music transitions. He gestures towards Vincent, signaling him to lower the volume. Suddenly, a peculiar figure crosses the space between the camera and the unfolding scene, disappearing as quickly as he appears, leaving it uncertain whether a robbery is taking place. Vincent's two street-wise friends simultaneously move with precision, sweeping all available objects into large sacks while one, Doug, pauses momentarily, casting a glance past the terrace towards the studio. Doug wields the hat rack first as an improvised spear, then as a club, initiating a short yet intense attack. As swiftly as they arrived, the three attackers leave the scene, prompting Vincent to tentatively start towards Simon, only to retreat in fear. A solitary bark from Verdell breaks the tension. Meanwhile, a mass of official people frantically fills the hall, surrounding a gurney that's urgently wheeled towards the elevator. Melvin stands with an air of detachment against the wall by his door, responding to questions from a cop named Ray. Nearby, Frank stands visibly distressed, clutching a dog bowl, a leash, and Verdell, who is equally agitated, emitting high-pitched cries. As our focus briefly falls on Verdell, Frank converses with a Sweet-Faced Woman. A sudden laugh reveals Melvin's enjoyment of Frank's agitated mutterings. Verdell begins whimpering as an agitated Frank confronts his mugger. Frank then forcefully pushes open the door to Melvin's apartment, depositing Verdell inside. We stay with the dog as he navigates the space, pausing when he senses Melvin's presence, and cautiously edging along the far wall. Melvin, somewhat amused by Verdell's apparent fear of him, finds it unexpectedly soothing. He cracks two eggs over a substantial pile of prime chopped meat, adroitly inserting raw bacon pieces into the mix, and then exits the room, showing Verdell no attention. Seated at the piano, Melvin strikes a single key repeatedly, each note echoing the suspicions bred from his recent experiences, leading him to suspect the lavish meal might be a ruse. Verdell gazes over, a mix of surprise and pleasure amplifying his expression. With careful movement, Verdell adjusts his body, positioning himself to eat from the bowl while keeping his tail turned towards Melvin. Meanwhile, Frank is engaged in a phone conversation, and as Jackie enters, he shifts his focus towards her. The sight of Simon's face is jarring, a distressing image that serves as a sudden shock to the system.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
Leslie recounts the story of a traumatic audition as she walks past Melvin without acknowledging him, all while he narrates her every move. Despite Melvin's commentary, Leslie continues, delivering an unusual rabbit punch as she passes him before exiting. In the busy greenhouse studio, Simon adds final touches to his painting of Vincent as Vincent selects music to play, feeling tense during the moments of silence. Suddenly, a strange figure briefly appears, indicating a robbery is underway. Vincent's street friends gather valuables into sacks, with Doug pausing to view the studio. Using a hat rack violently, they execute a quick attack before fleeing. Vincent hesitates but then retreats in fear as a single bark from Verdell echoes. 

Amid the chaos, official personnel navigate the hall with a gurney, while Melvin is questioned by a cop, Ray, near his door. Frank, holding Verdell and visibly upset, engages in a conversation with a Sweet-Faced Woman. Melvin, bemused by Frank's muttering, watches as Frank places Verdell inside Melvin’s apartment. Verdell, wary of Melvin, sticks close to the wall, which Melvin finds oddly soothing. After preparing a raw meal of eggs and bacon for Verdell, Melvin leaves him to dine skeptically, playing a single piano key repeatedly. Verdell turns his back to Melvin as he eats, surprised yet pleased. Simultaneously, Frank is on a phone call when Jackie enters the room, her presence drawing his attention. The shocking sight of Simon's face is revealed, adding to the drama.

test_cases.description: Leslie is telling the story of the traumatic audition, a crucial event in many performers' lives due to the intense pressure, which may have turned her life. The greenhouse studio, a popular hub for local artists known for its natural lighting, is a busy sanctuary as Simon puts the finishing touches on his painting of Vincent, whose likeness is frequently captured due to his striking features. And he uses the hat rack first as a spear, then as a club, improvising weapons in a frantic defense, as the brief savage attack begins. The three attackers leave, and Vincent starts to go toward Simon and then scurries back in fear, reminiscent of a startled animal. A single BARK from VERDELL, a small but feisty dog known for its keen intuition. A mass of OFFICIAL PEOPLE, probably law enforcement and emergency responders, clutter the hall as a gurney is whisked down to the elevator. Melvin is standing against the wall near his door, and a cop, RAY, likely familiar with the building's residents through numerous complaints, is interviewing him. Frank stands upset, anxious, holding a dog bowl, a leash, and VERDELL, who is more upset, making pathetic little CRYING sounds typical of distressed animals. As we FOCUS BRIEFLY ON Verdell, Frank is talking to the Sweet-Faced Woman, often seen as the building's unofficial mediator. A short laugh makes us realize that Melvin has witnessed and enjoyed Frank's hostile mutterings, as he frequently finds amusement in others' discomfort. VERDELL starts WHIMPERING as a pissed Frank approaches his mugger. Frank pushes open the door to Melvin's apartment, known for its impeccable cleanliness despite Melvin's gruff demeanor, and places Verdell inside. We STAY with the dog during the O.S. VERDELL STOPS—gives Melvin wide berth—slinking along the far wall. Melvin finds Verdell's fear of him, a result of an earlier altercation, a bit calming. Melvin breaks two eggs over a large pile of prime chopped meat, sticks raw pieces of bacon into it, creating a meal fit for a king, and exits the room. Ignoring Verdell, he sits at the piano and hits one key repeatedly, a habit developed from years of solitary reflection, his recent past making him suspect this feast is a trick. Verdell looks over with surprise and pleasure, not accustomed to such a lavish meal. Verdell shifts his body so he is eating from the bowl with his tail to Melvin. Frank is on the phone. As Jackie enters, he turns toward her, possibly to seek comfort or share the troubling news. Simon's face is something of a horror, and the sight is a jolt, evoking a visceral reaction from those around him.

During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. Frank stands upset anxious holding a dog bowl a leash and VERDELL who is more upset making pathetic little CRYING. As we FOCUS BRIEFLY ON Verdell Frank is talking to the SweetFaced Woman. A short laugh makes us realize that Melvin has witnessed and enjoyed Frank's hostile mutterings. VERDELL starts WHIMPERING as a pissed Frank approaches his mugger. Frank pushes open the door to Melvin's apartment and places Verdell inside. We STAY with the dog during the OS. VERDELL STOPS—gives Melvin wide berth—slinking along the far wall. Melvin finds Verdell's fear of him a bit calming. Melvin breaks two eggs over a large pile of prime chopped meat sticks raw pieces of bacon into it and exits the room. Ignoring Verdell he sits at the piano and hits one key repeatedly his recent past making him suspect this feast is a trick. Verdell looks over with surprise and pleasure. Verdell shifts his body so he is eating from the bowl with his tail to Melvin. Frank is on the phone. As Jackie enters he turns toward her. Simon's face is something of a horror and the sight is a jolt.

test_cases.description: Leslie is telling the story of the traumatic audition which may have turned her life. As they pass Melvin she does not break stride nor give him notice though she is aware of him  resentfully so  hard not to be since he is giving a momenttomoment commentary on her every action. Melvin stops and she passes behind him to deliver an uncharacteristic rabbit punch. Melvin just looks at her. She exits. The greenhouse studio is a busy sanctuary as Simon puts the finishing touches on his painting of Vincent. Vincent quickly and expertly picks a CD to meet his immediate needs and puts it on dying a little at every second of silence. during the transition he gestures Vincent to take it down. Melvin breaks two eggs over a large pile of prime chopped meat sticks raw pieces of bacon into it and exits the room. Ignoring Verdell he sits at the piano and hits one key repeatedly his recent past making him suspect this feast is a trick. Verdell looks over with surprise and pleasure. Verdell shifts his body so he is eating from the bowl with his tail to Melvin. Frank is on the phone. As Jackie enters he turns toward her. Simon's face is something of a horror and the sight is a jolt.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Gertrude is spinning the yarn of the delightful picnic which may have transformed her afternoon. As they glide by Rupert, she neither halts nor grants him acknowledgment, though she is conscious of him -- spitefully so -- difficult not to be since he is giving a blow-by-blow critique on her every maneuver. Rupert pauses, and she glides behind him to deliver an unanticipated feather slap. Rupert merely stares at her. She departs. The aviary courtyard is a tranquil refuge as Oliver places the finishing strokes on his mural of Claude. Claude briskly and skillfully selects a novel to satisfy his immediate desires and opens it, wilting a bit at each minute of quiet during the pause; he signals Claude to close it. A beat, and then a peculiar silhouette flits between the LENS and the tableau, vanished before we can scrutinize him further, where it is not evident that a heist is underway—Claude's two colleagues from the avenue gather all trinkets into vast satchels—one of them, Nigel, lingers to peer beyond the veranda to the courtyard. And he employs the umbrella stand first as a lance, then as a bludgeon, as the swift fierce skirmish commences. The trio of invaders departs, and Claude begins to move toward Oliver and then dashes back in trepidation. A solitary MEOW from FLUFFY. A throng of BUREAUCRATS congest the vestibule as a stretcher is whisked down to the lift. Rupert is leaning against the partition near his entry, and a detective, HANK, is questioning him. George stands distraught, uneasy, clutching a cat dish, a scarf, and FLUFFY, who is more distraught, making wretched little WAILING. As we ZOOM BRIEFLY ON Fluffy, George is conversing with the Kind-Hearted Lady. A brief chuckle makes us recognize that Rupert has observed and relished George's unfriendly grumblings. FLUFFY starts MOANING as a miffed George strides toward his thief. George nudges open the portal to Rupert's flat and places Fluffy inside. We LINGER with the cat during the O.S. FLUFFY HALTS—grants Rupert ample distance—creeping along the distant barrier. Rupert discovers Fluffy's trepidation of him somewhat soothing. Rupert cracks two almonds over a hefty mound of superior shredded lettuce, embeds raw slivers of carrot into it, and departs the chamber. Overlooking Fluffy, he perches at the guitar and strums one string consistently, his recent history making him suspect this banquet is a ruse. Fluffy glances over with astonishment and glee. Fluffy repositions his form so he is nibbling from the dish with his tail to Rupert. George is on the line. As Clara arrives, he pivots toward her. Oliver's visage is something of a shocker, and the spectacle is a jolt.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Leslie recounts her traumatic audition, ignoring Melvin's constant commentary. She delivers a rabbit punch and exits, while Simon finishes painting in the bustling greenhouse studio. Vincent selects music, disturbed by silence, as a robbery subtly unfolds. Thieves, including Doug, attack using a hat rack, leaving Vincent frightened. Official responders crowd the hallway, interviewing Melvin after the incident. Frank, with Verdell the dog, is upset. Verdell whimpers as Frank confronts his mugger. Frank leaves Verdell in Melvin's apartment, where the dog's fear calms Melvin. Melvin prepares a lavish meal, suspicious it's a trick, while Verdell enjoys it, cautiously keeping his distance. Frank phones as Jackie arrives, revealing Simon's disfigured face is shocking.
